ratings.rComments: Good professor. Clearly knows his stuff. Don't skip lecture, everything on the test is based on lecture. Gives pop quizzes. He makes lecture interesting and has a passion for the subject. However, he can be a bit disorganized. The midterm and final were hard and very specific. Don't expect practice tests or a review either. Would recommend.
Prof Stewart is a babe. An absolute gem. He's really witty/funny which makes the class fly by he and explains things very clearly. A+

See that flaming red pepper? Yeah, I'd say that's accurate. Stewart is a spicy man with layers of  intelligence and wit. I took this class thinking I was going to be watching  vids of seals and dolphins, but boy was I wrong. As long as you study, pay attention, and find men age 50+ attractive, you'll be fine.

Professor is a child. Seemed like he was high during class, would go on long rambling monologues that had little to do with the topic. Refused to add structure to course when I told him I had difficulty learning in his lecture. Failed his class, retook with another professor and got a B+.
Stewart is awesome. Not only does he make lectures more interesting, they are easy to understand. Essays are super easy because he doesn't even grade them himself.

Currently a freshman in my first semester and Dr. Stewart is definitely my favorite professor. I look forward to going to class and he makes his lectures very fun. It's a very good natural science gen-ed to take, though you have to work for an A. You will learn a lot of "cocktail information" from this guy. He's hilarious!

Hands down one of my favorite professors. He made class interesting, fun and I looked forward to his class. No one notices if youre not in class but i clicker points are taken. I learned much more than I expected and he his personality makes lectures enjoyable to attend. I definitely suggest taking any class with him!

I personally think that he's funnier than Altaner, but I would rather take the course with Altaner because he doesn't do i-Clicker participation. Go to classes because attendance is a huge component in your grade.
Easy. Cool dude.
Funny!

He is a good professor and is always making the class laugh.  The material gets boring at times but he tries to make it interesting.  Attendance for both lecture and discussion is mandatory because I clicker is 10% of grade and discussion assignments and homework due in discussion are a huge percent of your grade.

BEST CLASS I'VE EVER TAKEN! he makes jokes constantly during lecture. the homework is easy and you don't really need to read the book although this is not a blow off or easy A class! overall he makes this a great class and i always looked forward to his lectures...and i even learned some things in the process.

Its a large class so no one notices if you're gone. but the clicker questions presented during lecture do count into your grade. He goes off on tangents often which can be annoying but he's funny and you actually learn something from the class. You do need to read the book though, he doesn't always go over everything on the exams.

He was definitely interesting...always expect to stay exactly until the bell rings, he never lets class out early. He taught us what we needed to know. Made sarcastic comments a lot, so that made class bearable.
it is very important to attend class for clicker questions. He is really funny and i thought he was hot. HW was not difficult but it is really important to not blow the class off..

This class was NOT the blowoff I thought it would be...you really have to go to class for your iclicker points and so you understand the material...reading the book doesn't really help.  The tests are kinda hard...he's really funny though and his rants are great!  I guess he's kinda cute in an old guy sort of way...Do the extra credit in discussion

Going to class is pretty important to understanding the material and what will be on the tests.  He tells funny, interesting stories, and loves his work.  I'm not much of a science person, but I love this class.  The tests are medium-difficult.  You definitely have to study.  Not a blow off class, but not a TOO much work.  He's a great teacher.
After the first exam I realized that going to class was important, as well as very interesting. Great teacher. Not a blowoff class as I was hoping, but definitely recommended

Pay attention in lecture and study the notes you should be able to get an A.  The online quizzes and extra credit on the group portion of tests are easy points. Dr. Stewart is hilarious, tells crazy stories, and I really looked forward to going to class.

Great professor. One of my favorites at UofI. Really funny and loves talking about iceland, gin and tonic and how much his kids make him crazy. The Oceans isn't about marine biology its about the geology of the oceans but it still ends up being interesting. You do have to study some but its not that difficult unless you're useless in science

Prof. Stewart is hilarious and very good looking. He tries to fill the lecture with good 'cocktail party' information. However, this class is difficult. He's a cool guy, but if you are not interested in the oceans (how they're made and all that jazz, not swimming in them) or if you are terrible at science, I would not recommend this class.
stewart is a babe and class is very interesting. takes some work to do well..but its worth it

This class is def. NOT A BLOW OFF CLASS. It is also NOT about dolphins and pretty blue ocean water, like I thought it was. If you go to class and study for a good 15 hours before each test,you should get an A. Stewart is really hot though, and he is pretty funny! =)

So this class definitely isn't a blow off and takes a lot of studying to do well on the tests...but regradless the class is a lot of fun and full of interesting information and can be easy if you put in the work.  Prof stewart makes the class worthwhile.  He's a hotty and he is super funny so he keeps it interesting.  Likes to drink and let us know
He's really funny and a good teacher, I just don't like the class in general.

His classes are not blow off classes. He structures the tests so you have to go to class to be able to do well on them. If you go to class everyday and pay attention you should get a easy A, otherwise this class is somewhat difficult. He is a really funny and cool guy though. He loves to drink and smoke but he can also use a few spelling lessons.

Very funny, uses great examples in class. Tries to explain math, which may/may not be helpful. Tests are hard, but extra credit is available for each. Lab grading is very confusing, and the lab grade makes up a lot of your grade. Overall, the class is really interesting, as is Dr. Stewart, but labs and exams are quite a bit of work.

TAKE HIS CLASSES! he's hilarious, goes on funny rants during lectures. make sure you go to lecture for the iclicker points. Be sure to study hard for the exams though, it's definitely not a blowoff class, but one that you will enjoy.

I expected a somewhat easy physical science gen-ed when signing up for the course, but I ended up having to work hard for my A. Dr. Stewart's sense of humor  keeps the  lectures interesting, but make sure you keep detailed notes. The tests are DIFFICULT. Make sure you do the extra credit in discussion to keep your grade up.
Pretty easy class. Tests tend to be difficult, but enough point to make up for it. Likes to drink and makes sure you know it. Interesting topics.

Great prof.  Very funny, and knew what he was talking about.  Very fair on tests, helpful during reviews, and extremely clear at explaining topics.  Liable to go off topic from time to time, but it helps keep you awake.  I think you would have to try to bad grade, and it would still be difficult.  But seriously...coolest liberal ever.
Take this class! Easy A, very interesting

he's a nice teacher, likes the subject and i learned a lot. try to pay attention in to lecture and the tests are pretty good. he tries to help students understand, and most of the time you do understand.

Group exams, but make sure you still study yourself.  He is very passionate about this subject and it shows which makes being there more bearable .  Funny man.  I thought there was something cute about him for a 45-ish y/o guy.  Discussions did require some work.  Super approachable teacher.  Take this class for the Gen Ed.
He's totally hilarious. This class actually does require some effort, but I think it's pretty interesting. Lecture's totally bearable, discussion sections are kinda tedious.

michael stewart is a boss. He is hilarious and he makes going to lecture very easy. The online quizes are an automatic 100% for about 20% of your grade. The rest is based on the tests and the final. Go to lecture and study and you will be fine. The key is to not let the easiness of the first test deceive you into thinking they will all be that easy
very funny and definately out there. exams are based almost completely off lecture notes and slides and hardly ever text so attendance definately helps.
Hilarious and quirky. Makes things easy to understand and tells really funny stories about his college days.

This guy is amazing! I didn't know anything about this class before I took it, but boy am I glad I did. He is always telling jokes and stories. The class is actually kind of interesting too, which surprised me. Study the notes for an hour or two before the exams and you'll get an A easily.
funniest teacher at UIUC, class was challenging but fun and interesting with never a dull minute, TA Chris Henderson was awesome too!  Too bad he graduated. :(
I loved pro stewart hes a stud!!!
Cool guy, lectures are interesting, but by no means is this a blow off class. In general, if you go to class and study, you can do well. I did not, and got a C.

Stewart is a great professor. I went into the class not expecting much, but I ended up loving the class. Group exams. Tests are directly from lecture. Lots of pictures in lectures. Actually stayed awake in lecture.

Dr. Stewart is my favorite teacher here so far.  He was very goofy and told many off-the-topic stories, he's a little strange but its funny.  If u study the notes the tests are easy and u never have to open your book.  Good class and teacher!

Professor Stewart is one of my favorite instructors of all time. He is very funny and interesting, as well as informative.  I learned a lot from the class and it wasn’t difficult at all. Honestly, I never even opened up the book; all of the material that he tests you on is right out of the lectures. I highly recommend Dr. Stewart to anyone.
great...group tests are very nice and material is actually kind of interesting. lots of visuals. overall, need to study for the tests but if u know it ur fine.

An interesting class, but NOT rocks for jocks. This course IS DIFFICULT. I thought it would be a blowoff for a Gen-Ed, but his tests are quite hard. Interesting material and a funny guy, even at 9 AM, but I cannot repeat this enough: NOT rocks for jocks.
sooo incredibly clear. he explains things really well whihc means he actually teaches. and well for that matter.
It was a little harder than I thought, but I still did ok. Stewart can be pretty funny too.
Not as easy as I thought it would be. Clear in lecture.  Approachable. Funny. But he drops the lowest test grade???
he's a nice and funny guy, his powerpoints are really helpful, especially since he post it online, but the tests aren't as easy as I think they would be
Yeah ditto. NOT A BLOW OFF CLASS. totally hated it. but Dr. Stewart is funny and interesting. the class is pretty interesting too. But I got a C because I did terrible on the tests.
Good teacher and funny.  Can explain a bit too much at times, but all in all good!  Group exams, and he drops your lowest exam grade!

I took it as a blow off...its definitely not.  Who knew there would be so much to know about the oceans? Anyways hes a nice guy and his powerpoints are really clear and helpful.  he is Kinda sarcastic and goofy but thats one of the best parts of this class.
This class is harder than i thought, i took it as a blow off and ended up doing bad.
No Comments

No longer rocks for jocks, you have to study hard for those tests but lecture is interesting b/c he relates things to real life, section is tedious and boring, I dreading going every week, make sure you get a TA that speaks english
This class is supposed to be easy...apparently no one told him that!  His test blow!
No Comments
